paragraphs.content: Psalm 31
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 31

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In thee, O Lord, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.

paragraphs.content: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.

paragraphs.content: For thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name’s sake lead me, and guide me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name’s sake lead me, and guide me.

paragraphs.content: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.

paragraphs.content: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O LORD God of truth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord God of truth.

paragraphs.content: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the Lord.

paragraphs.content: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;

paragraphs.content: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.

paragraphs.content: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.

paragraphs.content: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.

paragraphs.content: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.

paragraphs.content: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.

paragraphs.content: For I have heard the slander of many: fear was on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I have heard the slander of many: fear was on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.

paragraphs.content: But I trusted in thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But I trusted in thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my God.

paragraphs.content: My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.

paragraphs.content: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies’ sake.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies’ sake.

paragraphs.content: Let me not be ashamed, O LORD; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let me not be ashamed, O Lord; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.

paragraphs.content: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.

paragraphs.content: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.

paragraphs.content: Blessed be the LORD: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed be the Lord: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.

paragraphs.content: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.

paragraphs.content: O love the LORD, all ye his saints: for the LORD preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O love the Lord, all ye his saints: for the Lord preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.

paragraphs.content: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.
